title: Paragliding with beautiful Himalayas viewsğŸ¤© ~ My Nepal visit - Part-2
content:
Hi Lgs!!ğŸ‘‹ğŸ¤©How are you!ğŸ™ğŸ¼Â Caption: A paragliding spot atÂ Sarangkot, Pokhara, Nepal.Â From where the HimalayasÂ are clearly viewed! Photographer Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDER , by my smart phone Samsung J7 Pro.Â Â Â Â Caption: A paragliding spot atÂ Sarangkot, Pokhara, Nepal.Â Here 2 Para Gliders start their paragliding ride with jumping from the mountain top.Â Photographer Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDER , by my smart phone Samsung J7 Pro.Â Â Â Continuation of my previous post â€œThe 'Himalayas views' at sunrise time! - my Nepal visit - Part-1â€Â ,Â now I would like to start writing another post of my Nepal visit â€“ Part-2, at Sarangkot, Pokhara, Nepal.Â You may see my before post to continue with my travel story.Â After watching the wonderful views of the Himalayas cliffs at sunrise period we back to our hotel and get our Breakfast too! Then we checked out from Hotel and started our drive to a very beautiful and famous Paragliding spot in Sarangkot, Pokhara. Here so many tourist come to paraglide , This spot is a mountain top and there is a smooth solves from the mountain top and very much fit for paragliding. The other Â most special thing of that place is , From here The Himalayas can be viewed very clearly.Â Â Caption: A paragliding spot atÂ Sarangkot, Pokhara, Nepal.Â Here 2 Para Gliders were preparing their paragliding ride with the help of the guide (Expert)Â  from the mountain top.Â Photographer Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDER , by my smart phone Samsung J7 Pro.Â Â Â Ok, Now Letâ€™s know shortly Â about Paragliding :Paragliding, sport of flyingÂ parachutesÂ with design modifications thatÂ enhanceÂ theirÂ glidingÂ capabilities. It is one of the most thrilling, exciting andÂ the recreational and competitive adventure sport of flying. Para gliders have no rigid framework; theÂ parachuteÂ canopy acts as aÂ wingÂ and is constructed of fabric cells with openings at the front that allow them to be inflated by movement through the airâ€”the â€œram-airâ€ effect.Â Caption: A paragliding spot atÂ Sarangkot, Pokhara, Nepal.Â Here a Paraglider is flying from the Mountain top of that paragliding spot.Â Photographer Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDER , by my smart phone Samsung J7 Pro.Â Â Â The pilot is suspended in a seated harness and controls the wing via lines attached to the trailing edge of the paraglider. These lines may be operated individually to turn the paraglider or simultaneously to influence pitch and speed. Takeoff and landing are on foot and usually occur on a hill or mountain. To launch, the pilot first inflates the wing by pulling it up like aÂ kiteÂ and then runs down the hillside until flying speed has been reached. Usually a speed of about 12 miles per hour (19 km per hour) is enough to launch the craft. Para gliders may also be launched from flatland by towing, either with a winch or behind a vehicle.Â Â Caption: A paragliding spot atÂ Sarangkot, Pokhara, Nepal.Â Here some Paragliders are flying from the Mountain top of that paragliding spot. That looked like 'birds' were flying ....Photographer Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDER , by my smart phone Samsung J7 Pro.Â Â Caption: Amination of some photos of me at the Paragliding spot atÂ Sarangkot, Pokhara, Nepal.Â Â Photographer Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDER , by my smart phone Samsung J7 Pro.Â Â Â Â Â Caption : A video made at the Paragliding spot atÂ  Sarangkot, Pokhara, Nepal.Â Â Photographer Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDER , by my smart phone Samsung J7 Pro.Â Â Â We stayed that Paragliding spot more than one hour and learn more about this flying, Also we took some photos of this place too! That time as we were new so did not flying, but next time I will surely ride that exciting paragliding! We learned much about the paragliding and it's riding methods.Â Â Caption: A view of the Himalayas from Pokhara , Nepal.Â Photographer Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDER , by my smart phone Samsung J7 Pro.Â Â Â After then we started our drive to Pokhara, This is also an amazing place! Many tourist from various countries come here for travelling and enjoy their holidays too.Â  I will tell later that story (Visiting Pokhara) with 'Nepal Trip part-3 and part -4'.Â Â I thinkÂ @AdamGTÂ  will like this post as he also visited Pokhara, Nepal too!ğŸ˜ğŸ˜Â Â Today ends up here ,Â ğŸ–ğŸ˜ŠÂ Pls. don't forget to comments here and also pls share your Himalayas or paragliding experiences here with photo if you have any!Â Â Have a nice day to all my friends!!ğŸŒ»ğŸŒ»Â MahbubWarm GreetingsÂ ğŸŒ¹ğŸ’— Â from Chittagong cityBangladesh.Â ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡©Â Pls click here to see my recent posts!!Â Â 

	MD MAHBUB HYDER

content:

title: Home made 'Falooda' ~ A great food for new generations! #monthly-topic
content:
Hi my dear LGs!ğŸ¤—ğŸ–Â How are doing!ğŸ¤©Â Many hugsÂ ğŸ¤ and greetingsğŸ’– virtually sendingÂ  to you !Â Â Hope everybody are safe and healthy too! ğŸ’šğŸ™ğŸŒ¿Â Falooda kept in a small dish.Caption: DeliciousÂ 'Falooda' keep in a small dish for serve in my dining table, Photographer, Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , by my smartphone Samsung A50.Â Â Â Today I love share with you a very delicious recipe - 'Falooda'. This is a one kind of cold dessert too!Â  This is now one of the great food for the new generations! This is a very healthy food too! This food first started from South Asian country mainly India and Bangladesh, Now a days it popular in many countries. And the method of preparing of this food vary man to man and place place, But Basic things are same, it can be modified with many types of food and colors too! For making this food more delicious some people put many types of indigents like nuts, Cashew nut, almond , some different types fragrances, edible colors, even some sweet fruits slices!Â Â Â Today I will show you a dish of 'falooda' that last month we prepared at our house to serve as one of theÂ  "Iftar"Â  food in the past Holy Ramadan!!Â Â What kind of foods and indigents are needed to make 'Falooda'?Sabja seeds or sweet basil seeds.Â Rose syrupÂ 'Falooda' sevÂ or vermicelli.Â Jelly or JelloÂ MilkNuts and dry fruitIce creamÂ falooda on my dining tableCaption: DeliciousÂ 'Falooda' keep in a big dish and a small dishes too, along with other food, served in my dining table, Photographer, Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , by my smartphone Samsung A50.Â Â Now let's see how to prepare it:Â 1. Syrup: In a saucepan, take sugar with some water and bring it to a boil inÂ  lowerÂ  heat and let it simmer. Add rose water, beet juice and simmer.2. Jello: you can make ready made jello as per package instructions. Let it chill to set.Â 3. Thick Milk: cook milk with sugar and reduce it to â…” of its original volume. Chill it.Â 4.Vermicelli: Cook the noodles in a saucepan with boiling water until al dente. Drain the vermicelli and chill.Â 5. Sweet Basil Seeds: In aÂ small bowl, soak the sweet basil seeds in water for about 30 minutes and let them swell up. Chill the basil seeds.Â How to Serve Falooda:TakeÂ tall glassesÂ or attractive drink ware. Layering in the following order is a suggestion.Drizzle rose syrupPlace some jelloNext a layer of vermicelliThen add soaked basil seedsFill the glass with milk up to â…” fullAdd a scoop of ice creamTop with nuts, some syrup and rose petals as your wish even add some fragrance, colors and fruit slice and dry fruits if you like to....~ Now let's eat the delicious 'falooda"Â  Â Special dish is ready for you!!!!Â Caption: DeliciousÂ 'Falooda' keep in a big dish and a small dishes too, along with other food, served in my dining table, Photographer, Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , by my smartphone Samsung A50. This in now totally ready to serve you too....Â Pls share your opinions how it taste ?Â Today ends up here !âœ‹Â See you againÂ with a new interesting topic!ğŸ˜Â Â Have a nice day to all my friends!Â ğŸŒ»ğŸŒ»ğŸ’›ğŸ’›Â Â MahbubWarm GreetingsÂ ğŸŒ¹ğŸŒ¹ Â from Chittagong cityBangladesh.Â ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡©Â Pls click here to see my recent posts!!Â Â 

	MD MAHBUB HYDER

title: The 'Himalayas views' at sunrise time! - my Nepal visit - Part-1
content:
Hi My all loving LGs!How are doing!Hope everybody are safe and healthy in this Covid pandemic period!Â Caption : It was me watching the Himalayas cliffs and waiting for the fantastic view from there.Â Photo captured from a mountain top of Sarangkot, Pokhara, Nepal.Â Photographer Local GuideÂ  @GoutammittraÂ Â , by my smart phone Samsung J7 Pro.Â Â Â Â Â the Himalayas view from Sarangkot, NepalCaption: A view of the Himalayas just 2/3 minutes before the clear sunrise( a periodÂ of just before the sun is up) , Photo captured from a mountain top of Sarangkot, Pokhara, Nepal.Â PhotographerÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , by my smart phone Samsung J7 Pro.Â Â Â Â We are really compelled to minimize our travelling for this Covid situation, As man of travelling for me it more painful! But I can share my previous visiting places with you guys!Â Today I will tell you a travel story in Nepal. I visited Nepal 2 times! And also love to visit again in future. Nepal is a country of different landscapes and most of the areas are surrounded bu Mountains and Hills. This country is a landlocked country and there is no sea beach or coastal areas in Nepal, They use Indian some ports to carry their goods, materialsÂ  for in and out. Although they don't have sea beaches , this country is enriched with so beautiful natural views.Â  Everybody knows about the Himalayas, My story today is about the Himalayas, and it is the post I mentioned - 'my Nepal visit- Part-1' gradually I will post Part -2 , Part-3.....Pls Keep up your eyes on my posts.....Â on the way to SarangkotCaption: A view of our road trip from Kathmandu toÂ Sarangkot, Pokhara, Nepal. Photographer Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ Â , by my smart phone Samsung J7 Pro.Â  It was an evening viewÂ Â 2018 January 1st weekÂ  I visitedÂ Sarangkot, Pokhara, Nepal.Â I stayed there 2 days with my some friends. I visited there for mainly two things one is from here The Himalayas is very near and the sunrise time the Himalayas looks fantastic from this place.2nd thing is this is a great place for paragliding, So many tourist come here to para glide from this place, in my future post I will write about this. Today I will focus sunrise views at the Himalayas. We stayed at a hotel in Sarangkot. The name of that hotel wasÂ Mountain View Lodge.Â  I remembered it was so cold night for us. We needed fireplace at our room to heat up our bodies!Â Â Night stay at Hotel at SarangkotCaption: We stayed at a Hotel namelyÂ Mountain View Lodge, A selfie of myself along with my one travel companion at my hotel room atÂ Sarangkot, Pokhara, Nepal. Photographer Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ  , by my smart phone Samsung J7 ProÂ The next day early in the morning, we went out and reach a mountain top near to our Hotel. The name of the place is Sarangkot view Tower. it is also known as sunrise point of the Himalayas views at Sarangkot! It's one of the great tourist spot of Nepal. It was a very cold morning for us as we are the people of tropical Region, I remembered we we fell so cold that we had to wear warm clothes and jackets and caps and hoods too! Even wearing all those clothing we were trebling by that cold weather. But after sunrise the weather became warmer and we feel good. Although we felt too cold but we were so exited to see the wonderful views from the Himalayas! It was really a great moment to those views!Â Â Caption : It was me watching the Himalayas cliffs and waiting for the fantastic view from there. It was a selfie of myself. Photo captured from a mountain top of Sarangkot, Pokhara, Nepal. Photographer Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , by my smart phone Samsung J7 Pro.Â  It was pretty cold time! I was trembling by cold weather.Â Â Caption : It was me watching the Himalayas cliffs and waiting for the fantastic view from there.Â Photo captured from a mountain top of Sarangkot, Pokhara, Nepal.Â Photographer Local GuideÂ  @GoutammittraÂ Â , by my smart phone Samsung J7 Pro.Â Â Â Â Caption: Other tourists were waiting too alongÂ with us to see the views of sunrise from the Himalayas!Â Photo captured from a mountain top of Sarangkot, Pokhara, Nepal. Photographer Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ  Â , by my smart phone Samsung J7 Pro.Â Â Â Â Caption: A view of the Himalayas just 3/4 minutes before the clear sunrise( a periodÂ of just before the sun is up) , Photo captured from a mountain top of Sarangkot, Pokhara, Nepal. Photographer Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ  Â , by my smart phone Samsung J7 Pro.Â Â Â Â Caption: A view of the Himalayas just 3/4 minutes before the clear sunrise( a periodÂ of just before the sun is up) , Photo captured from a mountain top of Sarangkot, Pokhara, Nepal. Photographer Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ  Â , by my smart phone Samsung J7 Pro.Â Â Â Â Caption: A view of the Himalayas just 2/3 minutes before the clear sunrise( a periodÂ of just before the sun is up) , Photo captured from a mountain top of Sarangkot, Pokhara, Nepal. Photographer, Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ  Â , by my smart phone Samsung J7 Pro.Â Â Â Â Caption: A view of the Himalayas just after just appearing the sun at sunrise period , The views of the Himalayas cliffs had been changed after sun was up!Â  Photo captured from a mountain top of Sarangkot, Pokhara, Nepal.Â Photographer Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ  Â , by my smart phone Samsung J7 Pro.Â Â Â Â Caption : It was me watching the Himalayas cliffs and waiting for the fantastic view from there.Â Photo captured from a mountain top of Sarangkot, Pokhara, Nepal.Â Photographer Local GuideÂ  @GoutammittraÂ Â , by my smart phone Samsung J7 Pro.Â Â Â Â We were eagerly waiting for sunrise views that would be piping up from the opposite side the Himalayas! It was so excited time, after a few moment it was gradually appearing form the Himalayas side and we become astonished to look at that fantastic and amazing views! It can't be describe by talking or writing. The real views can perfectly be seen only physical watching!Â Just before appearing the sunrise from the back top the Himalayas it looks so lovely. Sun rays reflecting on the top the Himalayas cliffs and make a romantic view! We looking up that scenery for a moment and so charmed by of those romantic and fantastic views!!!Â Â Caption: Breakfast making by ourselves with our portable instruments! at the Hotel corridor atÂ Sarangkot, Pokhara, Nepal. Photographer Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDER Â , by my smart phone Samsung J7 Pro.Â Â Â After then we back to our hotel and made our breakfast by ourselves we had a portable gas stove, we bought bread, butter, jam, milk from a superstore and make the break fast by ourselves, We had a electric heater too , we made our morning tea with this. at arround 10.00am we started for a paragliding spot at Sarangkot, I will tell that story later!Â Â Caption: After checked out from hotel we went to a beautiful paragliding spot atÂ Sarangkot, Pokhara, Nepal. Photographer Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDER , by my smart phone Samsung J7 Pro.Â Â Â Â Today ends up here ,Â ğŸ–ğŸ˜ŠÂ Pls. don't forget to comments here and also pls share your HimalayasÂ experiences here with photo if you have any!Â Â Have a nice day to all my friends!!ğŸŒ»ğŸŒ»Â MahbubWarm GreetingsÂ ğŸŒ¹ğŸ’— Â from Chittagong cityBangladesh.Â ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡©Â Pls click here to see my recent posts!!Â  Â Â 

	MD MAHBUB HYDER

title: A rainy day and  a cup of green teağŸ¤© ~ from my house windoww
content:
Hi Friends !It's a sudden decision post and I captured some photos just few times ago , I made my mind to write a topic! Pls share your opinions after see my post and photos!Â Â Caption: A photo of rainy nature from my house window with holding a cup of Green tea in my hand , Photographer : @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , by my smartphone Samsung A50Â Â Caption: A photo of rainy nature from my house window with holding a cup of Green tea in my hand , Photographer : @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , by my smartphone Samsung A50Â This afternoon after lunch I took little rest at my house and had a cup of green tea , looking at the window towards to the nature and few time later it was raining and I became more attend to the natural views outside of my house window! content:

Also I am writing this post celebrating the "World's Ocean day"Â . Actually by the influence of the post written byÂ @SilvyCÂ , I love to write this post too! I already visited more than 50 Sea beaches in the world including my native some special beaches too. I will share you some of photos captured from various Sea beaches in the different countries. I alos request you to all to share yourÂ Ocean/Sea/beach travelling experiences.Â Â A sea beach in BaliCaption: Photo Captured from Suluban beach in Bali, IndonesiaÂ . PhotographerÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , Device : Samsung J7proÂ What is Ocean and Sea? Ocean is not a huge body of blue water or strong waves hit on the shore and beaches. It is also a part of our life, our poetry, romanticness, philosophical views ....Â Â Â at Cox's bazarCaption: A photo of myself! Photo Captured from World's Largest sea Beach at Inani, Cox Bazar, Bangladesh.Â Device : Nikon D3200Â Itâ€™s not always easy to find the right words to articulate the vastness and might of the ocean. Luckily, many of the worldâ€™s most renowned authors, poets, scientists, and philosophers have developed a deep affection for the ocean during their lifetimes. As such, they have found marvelous words to describe the beauty of the ocean and sea and its waves too!.Â Â Bali , IndonesiaCaption: A photo of myself! Looking forward to see the vastness of the ocean, Photo captured from Uluwatu sea beach Bali, Indonesia by my Device : Samsumsung J7 pro, help to take this pic by my companion!Â Â I love the vastness of the ocean too much. I also love its serenity, tranquility, humility, and purifying powerâ€¦~ When I Stand at the beach looking at the angry and wild ocean currents moving toward me, I feel life â€“ ever-changing!, aggressive!!, persistent!!!, yet silent.!!!!Â Â Caption: Photo Captured from Bali, Indonesia. PhotographerÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , Device : Samsung J7proÂ Â  ~ There are many similarity with our life and ocean. ~ Life also doesnâ€™t stop moving like the ocean. We must carry on with it.~ Sometimes, it simply wants us toÂ let goÂ of our beliefs. And other times it wants us toÂ start over again.Â Â Phukhel, ThailandCaption: Photo Captured from Phuket, Thailand. This is really important us and for our future generation to save the Ocean and the fauna of the sea and ocean! You may know that the ocean covers almost 71% of the surface of the whole earth. Also This day reminds us of the major role the oceans have in everyday of our life. They are the lungs of our Planet and a great source of foods and medicines and a critical part of the biosphere. Everyday Thousands Metric tons of fishes and sea foods are collected from sea and ocean all over the world! But Now a days Many made abstract, garbage, plastic bottles, cans and different types of poly bags and polythene go the sea and ocean mix with water and also those things make a cover on the sea ground surfaces! That is so much alarming for our sea and ocean and fishes. This is high time we should take care specially about pollutions of ocean. title: A natural green ğŸŒ¿  â€˜Shedâ€™ & â€˜Shadowâ€™ ğŸŒ³- CRB, Chittagong - part-2- Celebration of Environment day!
content:
Hi LGs!!Â ğŸ–How are youÂ  doingÂ  myÂ  dearÂ  friends!?Â Hope you all are well and sound!ğŸ’šğŸŒºÂ GreetingsğŸŒ¹ from Chittagong city, Bangladesh!ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡©Â Today is 5th June! World Environment day!Â ğŸŒ± My post is for celebrating 'World Environment day'!Â Do you know about ChittagongÂ ? How much know about Chittagong.Â  So beautiful, marvelous and amazing state Chittagong is! , Chittagong is enriched with sea, worlds' largest sea and sand beach, so many beautiful lakes. mountains, hills, river, waterfalls so many different types of Landscapes. Even only Chittagong cityÂ also so beautiful! New name of Chittagong is "Chattogram" Gradually I will show you more about Chittagong division and Chittagong city. Pls keep your eyes on my posts to see the beauty of Chittagong!ğŸ˜ƒğŸ§¡Caption: A beautiful green nature, view of big trees at CRB area during my visit. PhotographerÂ @MAHBUB_HYDER, device used,: my smartphone Samsung A50Â Â Caption: A beautiful green nature, view of big trees at CRB area during my visit. PhotographerÂ @MAHBUB_HYDER, device used,: my smartphone Samsung A50Â Â Caption: A beautiful green nature, view of big trees at CRB area during my visit. PhotographerÂ @MAHBUB_HYDER, device used,: my smartphone Samsung A50â€ƒÂ Caption: A beautiful green nature, view of big trees at CRB area during my visit. PhotographerÂ @MAHBUB_HYDER, device used,: my smartphone Samsung A50Â Â I am going to write a post of a very quiet and peaceful place that looks like you are in & under a natural green â€œShedâ€™ and â€œShadowâ€! Last year I also wrote anÂ "article"Â about this place too. But today I want to show you how it Looks like ! You will confess that that place is really a very cool and natural green shed and shadow! The name of the place is CRB or Â CRB HillsÂ area, CRB Hill area has many small and big hills that makes the place views more attractive. This place located in the heart of Chittagong city.Â  It is about 3 km from our Zero point, i.e. from Chittagong New Market area. Â It seems to be a little green heaven too! Many times I need to move through that place for my general works but whenever I remain less busy I stop my bike for a while and keep watching the beauty of that place and also take a little rest by sitting under a tree at roadside!! This place must attacks any nature lover! Doesn't it?Â â€ƒCaption: A beautiful green nature, view of big trees at CRB area during my visit. PhotographerÂ @MAHBUB_HYDER, device used,: my smartphone Samsung A50Â Â Caption: A beautiful green nature, view of big trees at CRB area during my visit. PhotographerÂ @MAHBUB_HYDER, device used,: my smartphone Samsung A50Â This place is surrounded by many ancient and very big rain trees, even their roots are scattered with wide areas. As there are so many big rain trees are standing one after one, it makes a cool and peaceful place for short recreation. When you stay there you will that you are under a very beautiful natural green shed and shadow! Â Â Â â€ƒCaption: A selfie of myself (riding a bikeÂ  wwearing aÂ  helmet) in a beautiful green nature, view of big trees at CRB area during my visit. PhotographerÂ @MAHBUB_HYDER, device used,: my smartphone Samsung A50Â Â Caption: A selfie of myself (riding a bikeÂ  wwearing aÂ  helmet) in a beautiful green nature, view of big trees at CRB area during my visit. PhotographerÂ @MAHBUB_HYDER, device used,: my smartphone Samsung A50â€ƒÂ A few days ago I visited in the heart of Chittagong city in the day time. And took some selfie, trees, and natural photos of that area. And decided to post an article regarding this! What do you think my dear friend ? Did I take correct decision?Â This area lands is about 2 sq. km wide and long, One side CRB Railway building ( a very big, ancient, and famous Administrative Office and Head quarter of Bangladesh Railway department,) Â other side is Railway hospital, Railway Hospital colony (residential area), Chittagong Stadium, Railway Officersâ€™ Club, and Tiger pass Circle.Â Â Caption: A beautiful green nature, view of big trees at CRB area during my visit. PhotographerÂ @MAHBUB_HYDER, device used,: my smartphone Samsung A50Â Â â€ƒCaption:Â  CRB 7 Raster Matha ( 7 roads are joint here in CRB circle) , A beautiful green nature, view of big trees at CRB area during my visit. PhotographerÂ @MAHBUB_HYDER, device used,: my smartphone Samsung A50Â Â This area also have a circle road namely CRB 7 Raster Matha. From this circle whole CRB area easily can be seen. CRB hills area now a days becomes a great recreation area and a very lovely Tourist attraction!Â â€ƒCaption:Â  Some photo collegeÂ  of someÂ  beautiful green nature, view of big trees at CRB area during my visit. PhotographerÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , by my smartphone Samsung A50Â Â How to Reach CRB Hills area:AS CRB Hills located in center of Chittagong city you can easily reach there very easily from any edge of Chittagong City. No public transport are available here, you can come here by private transportationsÂ  like ,Bicycle, bike, car, microbus and auto 3 wheelers. But If you want reach that place by Public Bus you should get down at Tigerpass CircleÂ , then you have to walk up to the place within 5~7 minutes! Public buses available at Tigerpass Circles are # 2, #6, #7, #8. You may come here from other sides also, like Kadamtali Circle, Chittagong Stadium, Batali Road etc.Â Â * Entry fee: There is no entry fee and open it for public for 24 hours. Â Accessibility & and other facilities!:WheelchairÂ chair â€“ YesWheelchairÂ parking â€“ Yes (but only roadside, plain areas and only some hills hat have road, some of the Hill areas have no parking)RestaurantÂ facilities - Yes here have some floating restaurantÂ have for light refreshment!Â Toilet - There are no toilets in this area but if you use CRB mosque Toilet instead that is close to this area!Â NearbyÂ Attractions:CRB Central Jame MasjidÂ Railway Officerâ€™s ClubÂ MA Aziz StadiumÂ Radisson Blu Chattogram Bay ViewÂ Chittagong ClubÂ CRB Administrative Office Building ComplexÂ Â Today ends up here, See you again with other interesting topics in future too!Â Â Â Have a nice day my friends!Â ğŸŒ»ğŸŒ»Â MahbubLocal Guide ğŸ‘¨â€âœˆï¸ of Chittagong city, Bangladesh.ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡©Here is my recent posts for you!Â 

	MD MAHBUB HYDER

title: A travelling for relax and refreshing at â€˜Dakshin Kattali Sea Beachâ€™
content:
Hi Lgs!Â ğŸ–How are you?Â ğŸ¤—Today I love to share my recent travel story at a beautiful sea beach closest to my house area, along with my family!Â ğŸ˜Â Â Caption: A fishing boat is standing on the sea beach surface after finishing a fishing in the sea and waiting for next sail. Photo captured by Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , Device: Samsung J7 proÂ Â Caption: Sunset view from the Sea beach with ships views in the sea,Â  photographer - @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ  by my Smartphone SamsungA50Â Â Caption: A ship view from tree side in the sea beach,Â  photographer - @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ  by my camera: Nikon D3200Â Â Â A fishing boats is standing on the sea beachCaption: A fishing boat is standing on the sea beach surface after finishing a fishing in the sea and waiting for next sail. Photo captured by Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , Device: Samsung J7 pro.Â A fishingsome fishing boats are waiting to sail on after High tides standing on the sea beachCaption: SomeÂ  fishing boats are waitingÂ for sail out for fishing in the sea. Photo captured by Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , Device: Samsung J7 proÂ Fishermen are preparing their fishing nets  to fishing in the seaCaption: Some Fishermen are preparing and repairing their net to sail out for fishing in the sea ,Â Photo captured by Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , Device: Samsung J7 pro.Â Â Caption : Photo College of boats view in the sea beach area. Photographer - Local Guide @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , by Samsung A50Â Â Staying at Home for long time due to Covid pandemic situation makes all my members so crazy and bored. Every body need to breathe in a clean, lively green and wide nature. So, we decide to go at sea beach that is closed to my house.Â  Â 2nd day of EID (15th May 2021) we hangout for a mini picnic cum visiting sea beach with whole my family. From our area (Akbar Shah Railway Housing ) to the nearest Sea Beech, namely -Â â€˜Dakshin Kattali Sea Beachâ€™ /â€˜à¦¦à¦•à§à¦·à¦¿à¦£ à¦•à¦¾à¦Ÿà§à¦Ÿà¦²à§€ à¦¸à¦®à§à¦¦à§à¦° à¦¸à§ˆà¦•à¦¤â€™ Â which is about 7~8 kilometers from my house, we hired a CNG Auto to reach there. And we paid Tk. 200 for this trip ($2.5).Â Caption: A selfie of myself along with my full family was about to start to the sea beach in afternoon on the 2nd day of "EID"Photographer- Local Guide @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ Â Caption: A view of sea beach with some boats and people, visited this sea beach,Â Photo captured by Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , Device: Samsung J7 proÂ Â Caption: An evening view of the sea beach,Â Photo captured by Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , Device: Samsung J7 proÂ Â Caption: A boat view in the sea beach,Â  photographer - @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ  by my camera: Nikon D3200Â Â Â Â Caption: Trees view in the sea beach,Â  photographer - @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ  by my camera: Nikon D3200Â Â Â Â Caption: Some landscapes trees view in the sea beach,Â  photographer - @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ  by my camera: Nikon D3200Â Â Caption: some landscapes and trees view in the sea beach,Â  photographer - @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ  by my camera: Nikon D3200Â Â Letâ€™s know in brief about - Â Â â€˜Dakshin Kattali Sea Beachâ€™ /â€˜à¦¦à¦•à§à¦·à¦¿à¦£ à¦•à¦¾à¦Ÿà§à¦Ÿà¦²à§€ à¦¸à¦®à§à¦¦à§à¦° à¦¸à§ˆà¦•à¦¤â€™Â In Chittagong city, Â if go to the south side through the Chittagong Coastal Road, you can see only sea and sea beaches of different landscapes, there are so many spots have to visit sea beaches in Chittagong city , but 8-10 are very famous!Â  And people of Chittagong city even from other districts visit and enjoy their afternoon and evening those spots.Â  â€˜Dakshin Kattali Sea Beachâ€™ /â€˜à¦¦à¦•à§à¦·à¦¿à¦£ à¦•à¦¾à¦Ÿà§à¦Ÿà¦²à§€ à¦¸à¦®à§à¦¦à§à¦° à¦¸à§ˆà¦•à¦¤â€™Â  is one of them. In the Google maps this place is showing as duplicate names, other name of the sea beach in the Google Maps is South Kattali Sea Beach , Both are places are in same area but created two places! This sea beach also very known asÂ  Jele para Sea beach too. (à¦œà§‡à¦²à§‡à¦ªà¦¾à¦¡à¦¼à¦¾ à¦¸à¦®à§à¦¦à§à¦° à¦¸à§ˆà¦•à¦¤), â€˜Jele paraâ€™ means fishermen place, as many fishermen reside and anchor their boats at this place , this place name become â€œJele para Sea beachâ€ too. (à¦œà§‡à¦²à§‡à¦ªà¦¾à¦¡à¦¼à¦¾ à¦¸à¦®à§à¦¦à§à¦° à¦¸à§ˆà¦•à¦¤),Â Â Caption: My family members are walking around the beach area, photographer- Local Guide @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ Â First impression of entering into this place, you can see many of colorful fishing boats are scattered this area. Then if you enter some inside then you can see plenty of green trees, grassy field, muddy surfaces, and even some sandy surfaces around this place. A very nice and cool environment in that place. No doubt a wonderful place for any nature lover, One side many of Fishing boats, other side so many green trees, and sea beaches views as well as different types of Landscape views are also fantastic. In the evening time and sunset time the views become so attractive and marvelous.Â Where it is located ad how to reach there:It is located at South Kattali area, Pahartali, Chittagong, It is very close to Chittagong Coastal Road (Toll Road) at South Kattali point. Â From Chittagong city anyone can easily come here through Chittagong Coastal Road (Toll Road) in reach the South Kattali point. If anyone come from inside the Pahartali area he can follow first the â€˜Zahur Ahmed Chowdhury Stadium (it's maps link here)'Â at Sagorika, beside that stadium there is a road connected to the Beach area through the Coastal (toll) road. You can use CNG Auto taxi, Private car, Microbuses to reach there, Public buses are not available at the place.Â Famous places nearby this Sea beach:Zahur Ahmed Chowdhury Stadium (maps link)Halishahar beachShuktara Chinese Restaurant and parkKattali beachCoastal Mermaid Restaurant & LoungeÂ We reached at the Sea beach in the afternoon around 04.30pm and first we pitched a tent in the beach area on an open grassy field. As this place have no house or seating place, then we move around and enjoy the beauty of this area, we took many photos of this area, I also contribute in google Maps adding some photos! Then we cooked simple Noodles with egg and vegetables. (We collected those from our house and only cooked there.Â Caption: A photo of our camping site in the sea beach area, photographer Local Guide - @MAHBUB_HYDER, By may camera: Nikon D3200Â Â Caption: A college of photos of our camping site in the sea beach area, photographer Local Guide - @MAHBUB_HYDER, By may camera: Nikon D3200Â Â Â Â Â Caption: A photo of our camping site in the sea beach area, my office staff was preparingÂ  vegetable egg noodles for us..photographer Local Guide - @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ  , device: Nikon D3200Â Â Â After then we ate together in front of our camping site with so relaxing mood. We enjoyed our eating along with natural beauties of the surroundings.Â Â Caption: my wife (smiling woman) along with my 2 daughters are walking around at iur camping site ,Â photographer Local Guide - @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ  , device: Nikon D3200Â Caption: A college of photos of my family at our camping site,Â  gossiping and eating foods, photographer Local Guide - @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ  , device: Nikon D3200Â Â Â Caption: My family members are walking around and climbing trees and enjoyed by themselves at the sea beach area.Â photographer Local Guide - @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ  , device: Nikon D3200Â Â Caption: Sunset view at the Sea beach area,Â Â â€ƒÂ photographer Local Guide - @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ  , device: Nikon D3200Â Â Caption: some photos college of my self at the sea beach area,Â  captured by my one office staff , Device : Nikon D3200Â Â Advantages/Disadvantages:Itâ€™s an open area and no entrance feesWe can stay there any time without no bound but strongly recommended not to stay at night as that place is very quiet after evening, not secured, protected place at night.Wheelchairs are not accessiblePublic toilets are not availableÂ After eating our foods, we again moved to the beach area and took some evening nature photos of the beach areas. After sunset we back to our house by again CNG Auto.Â Today end up here! Hope see you again with other interesting article! Pls. don't forget to review my post and give your valuable comment in this regard!Â Â All the best!!ğŸ˜ğŸ¤Â Have a great my friends!Â ğŸŒ»ğŸŒ»Â MahbubWarm greetingsfrom Chittagong city, Bangladesh.Â ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡©

	MD MAHBUB HYDER

title: My â€˜EIDâ€™ starts with Rain! â€“ What about your â€˜Eid dayâ€™, Plz. share here!
content:
Hi LGs!ğŸ˜ğŸ–Â Caption: A selfie of myself on EID day today! Watching rainy nature from my house balcony,Â  Photographer @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , by my smartphone Samsung A50.Â Â â€œâ€˜Eid Mubarakâ€! ????!And my heartiest â€œâ€˜Eidâ€ greeting ?? to all of my loving friends!Â Many happy returns on you and your family!???Â Â Today (14th May 2021)in my country, Bangladesh we (Muslims) celebrate very special Festival name â€œEid - Ul - FitrÂ ".Â  It is considered as the biggest festival for Muslims all over the world. After completing one month long fasting we start eating and other general activities same as before! After finishing fasting â€“ first day is the main festival day, but the image and cheers of the EID festival remains after 2/3 days too. Â In many Muslim country EID festival holidays provides a long days, it may be minimum 3 days to maximum 7 days long. (it depends on country, situation and others ), we follow Arabic calendar to count fasting period and EID day too! Fasting continue full months of â€œRamadanâ€( Arabic month) and EID day counts as the 1st day of â€œShowalâ€ (Arabic Month)Â Caption: Last evening (after sunset)1st moon of Shawal captured by my Smartphone Samsung A50, Photographer , Local Guide @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , we eagerly waiting for this moon ! This moon directly notify "EID DAY"Â Caption: Sunset view from my house roof last evening, we are eagerly waiting for the 1st moon of Shawal captured by my Smartphone Samsung A50, Photographer , Local Guide @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , we eagerly waiting for this moonÂ  as this his moon directly notify "EID DAY"!!Â Â We eagerly find the appearance of 1st moon of â€œShowalâ€ in the evening of the last day of fasting ( last day of Ramadan month), Whenever we see the 1st moon of â€œShowalâ€ our minds become full of happiness and exciting. I remember in my boyhood we start dancing and shouting with cheering voices among with our relatives and neighbors' children, after see the 1st Moon of Showal! Means the next day will be our EID day! It is an untold feelings inside out minds!Â Â Caption: A selfie of myself along with my son (viewed at my left side with wearing a black Panjabi. At Akbarshah Railway Housing Jame Mosjid(a mosque nereby my house)Â . Chittagong,Â  BangladeshÂ Photographer @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , by my smartphone Samsung A50.Â Â Ok. Come to point now â€“ I will tell my story of EID day today, I will tell you my activities of this festival day. How I celebrate my EID day. From the morning it was a cloudy day! I went to theÂ Akbarshah Railway Housing Jame Mosjid(a mosque nereby my house), nearby my house along with my Son to pray our EID special prayers with taking all possible safety measures (also maintaining full social distances) and personal protections! (EID special "Salat" / Prayer generally holds in the morning around from 7.00am to 10.00am).Â  After complete our EID prayers at 08.45am, I back to home and eat some special foods that cooked and arranged by my wife! She is a very good cook, and she knows how to prepare many delicious dishes, Today she cooked and arranged some sweet items Like â€œShemaiâ€, â€œJordaâ€, â€œFaludaâ€, â€œfruits custardâ€ Â and Biryani and also some Â meat items along with salad! We eat every items little along withÂ  my full family members. After I give some foods to my house securities (as they are poor). Also send some foods to our neighborsâ€™ houses!Â Â Caption : Some of food dishes prepared by my wife at my house and served at our house dining table for EID day celebration,Â Â Photographer @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , by my smartphone Samsung A50.Â Â Caption : Some of food dishes prepared by my wife at my house and served at our house dining table for EID day celebration,Â Â Photographer @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , by my smartphone Samsung A50.Â Â Â After then about 10.00 am it starts a heavy rain at my area, I am fully stuck at home.As Covid -19 pandemic situation is bad here and also our Govt. declared Lockdown (it continued almost 2 months). We could not move freely and could join with other friends and relatives. Full day just stay in my house. As it was rain in the morning so it also stuck us more for outing too. 2/3 hours I just enjoyed the nature of rain from my house windows and balcony. It felt nice and hear the beautiful rhythm of rain sounds, and I felt down a deep romantic and poetic moments /impressions and enjoyed a lot of rainy nature. Pls see the beow photos to enjoy a rainy nature at my place!:Â Caption : A rainy nature captured from my house window today at EID day ,Â PhotographerÂ  Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , by my smartphone Samsung A50.Â Â Â â€ƒCaption : A rainy nature captured from my house window today at EID day ,Â PhotographerÂ  Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , by my smartphone Samsung A50.Â Â Â Caption : A rainy nature captured from my house window today at EID day ,Â PhotographerÂ  Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , by my smartphone Samsung A50.Â Â Caption : A couple of photos of aÂ rainy nature captured from my house window and balcony today at EID day ,Â PhotographerÂ  Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , by my smartphone Samsung A50.Â â€ƒÂ Â Caption : A couple of photos of aÂ rainy nature captured from my house window and balcony today at EID day ,Â PhotographerÂ  Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , captured by my smartphone Samsung A50.Â â€ƒÂ Â Do you have any experiences to enjoy a rainy day for a few hours? It make you a wonderful moment if you have nature loving and artistic mind! In the meantime some children of my neighboring house came to our house to enjoy the EID days with us mainly with my son and they were gossiping and had some food at my house. A little girl of my neighboring house also played with me for a moment!Â Caption; Selfie of myself along with a little girl of my neighboring house,Â  I was playing with her for a while !Â ,,Â Photographer -Â  Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , captured by my smartphone Samsung A50.Â Â Caption: A group of children along my son were enjoying at my house tis EID day.Â PhotographerÂ  Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , by my smartphone Samsung A50.Â Â Caption: A view of front of Garibullah Shah Mazar and mosque , Grave yard of my parents is here ,,Â PhotographerÂ  Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , by my smartphone Samsung A50.Â Â Caption: AÂ  few of selfie of myself in front of my parents' grave atÂ  Hazrat Garibullah Shah(R) Mazar Grave yardÂ .Â ,Â PhotographerÂ  Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , by my smartphone Samsung A50.Â Â Â Caption: A view of some graves of various people atÂ Hazrat Garibullah Shah(R) Mazar Grave yard. my parents graves are alsoÂ  is here ,,Â Photographer - Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , by my smartphone Samsung A50.Â Â But after few hours later sky again became clear, and we had a full shining and bright day!Â  After taking Lunch and noon prayers I took some rest at my bed room and again performed afternoon prayer I moved to the grave yard of my parents! This grave yard is public and it is very famous grave yard in Chittagong city. The name of the grave yard is â€œHazrat Garibullah Shah(R) Mazar Grave yard"Â Â My father and mother buried in the same place! And I hanged a signboard besides their graves to recognize easily! There are thousands of graves here in this grave yard and sometimes itâ€™s very difficult to find your desired one! Anyway I have performed a payer belong to their spiritual lives (after world) and then again back to my sweet house, Before evening about an hour I enjoyed at my house roof garden (topmost roof â€“ NB- I have total 3 gardens at my house roof and I discussed it my earlier post of Earth day) I took some photos there and enjoyed the beauty of nature, From my house one side (north) is hills and other side (south) is sea.Â Captionâ€ƒ: My Roof garden view Captured this evening,Â PhotographerÂ  Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , by my smartphone Samsung A50.Â â€ƒCaption: Flowers of my Roof garden. Captured this evening,Â PhotographerÂ  Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , by my smartphone Samsung A50.Â Â Captionâ€ƒ: My Roof garden view Captured this evening,Â PhotographerÂ  Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , by my smartphone Samsung A50.Â Â Â Caption: Flowers of my Roof garden. Captured this evening,Â PhotographerÂ  Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , by my smartphone Samsung A50.Â Â â€ƒCaption: Flowers of my Roof garden. Captured this evening,Â PhotographerÂ  Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , by my smartphone Samsung A50.Â Â Â Caption: Flowers of my Roof garden. Captured this evening,Â PhotographerÂ  Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , by my smartphone Samsung A50.Â Â Caption: I am enjoying the surrounding nature and flowers of my Roof garden and stay there about an hour in the afternoon to Evening on EID day , Captured those photos one of friend by my camera Nikon D3200.Â Caption: Views from my house roof garden. I am enjoying the surrounding nature and stay there about an hour in the afternoon to Evening on EID day , Captured those photos by Local Guide- @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , device used my camera "Nikon D3200"Â Caption: Flowers voews from my house roof garden. I am enjoying the surrounding nature of my roof garden and stay there about an hour in the afternoon to Evening on EID day , Captured those photos by Local Guide- @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , device used my camera "Nikon D3200"Â Caption: Sea Views from my house roof garden. ( ITS ABOUT 10 KM FROM MY HOUSE BUT CLEARLY SEEN FROM MY ROOF GARDEN) I am enjoying the surrounding nature and stay there about an hour in the afternoon to Evening on EID day , Captured those photos by Local Guide- @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , device used my camera "Nikon D3200"Â Â Â Oh! I forget to inform you that , on that special Eid day also I didn't forget to contribute in the Google Maps! I reviewed and add photos some place on the way to visit my parents grave yard!Â Last year and this year Eid celebrations of course little different! AsÂ  Covid -19,pandemic situations reduce our EID celebration activities much! However I enjoyed my day very nicely and happily !Â Â Â After then again I go for Evening prayer!Â  And after finishing evening prayer I started writing this topic...!Â Pls give your reviews how you like my "Celebrating Eid day" !! And share your EID day high lights in the comment area!ğŸ˜ğŸ™ğŸ¤Â Today I am going to ending up Here!!Â Â Â Have a great day my friends!ğŸŒ»ğŸŒ»ğŸ’™ğŸ’™Â Mahbub

	MD MAHBUB HYDER

title: A flower that smile with you in the coastal areas ~ A story of 'Sagor lata' or 'Beach Morning'
content:
Hi LGsğŸ˜!How are you dear?Today I will tell you a very interesting Flowers story through my photography ğŸ¤—:Â A Sagor lata flower view at Cox's bazar sand beachCaption: A flower of "Sagor Lata /Kolmi Lota" i.e. "Beach Morning Glory" is creeping up on the shore of Inani Sea Beach, Cox's Bazar, Bangladesh.Â  It "looks like smiling with me on my way to sea shoreÂ ğŸ˜Š" , Photographer - Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , by my smartphone SamsungÂ A50. Duration of capture - Last year while I travelled there.Â Â Â Caption: A pair of "Sagor Lata/Kolmi Lota" i.e. "Beach Morning Glory" is creeping up on the shore of Inani Sea Beach, Cox's Bazar, Bangladesh.Â  It "looks like smiling with me on my way to sea shoreÂ ğŸ˜Š" , Photographer - Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , by my smartphone SamsungÂ A50. Captured it Last year while I travelled there.Â Â Â Caption:Â "Sagor Lata/Kolmi Lota" i.e. "Beach Morning Glory" is creeping up on the shore of Inani Sea Beach, Cox's Bazar, Bangladesh.Â  It "looks like it also walking/creeping with me in the beach and smiling too with me ğŸ˜Š"Â Photographer - Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , by my smartphone SamsungÂ A50. Duration of capture - Last year while I travelled there,Â Here one my friend and Local guide @GoutammittraÂ also with me travelled there and he is inside in the photoframe. He was also capturing photo of "Sagor lata"Â Smiling with me a pir of  'Sagor Kolmi 'Caption: A pair of "Sagor Lata/Kolmi Lota" i.e. "Beach Morning Glory" is creeping up on the shore of Inani Sea Beach, Cox's Bazar, Bangladesh.Â  It "looks like smiling with me on my way to sea shoreÂ ğŸ˜Š" , Photographer - Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , by my smartphone SamsungÂ A50. Captured it Last year while I travelled there.Â Â Â Â Â Â Capturing photo of 'Sagor lata' flowerCaption: I am here capturing the photo of "Sagor Lata/Kolmi Lota" i.e. "Beach Morning Glory" in a morning last year with myÂ smartphone SamsungÂ A50, with a LG logo on the back cover, Photographer one of companion used my Smartphone "SamsungÂ J7pro" Photo captured from Inani Sea Beach, Cox's Bazar, Bangladesh.Â Â Â A creeping plant 'Kolmi lota 'Caption:Â "Sagor Lata/Kolmi Lota" i.e. "Beach Morning Glory" is creeping up on the shore of Inani Sea Beach, Cox's Bazar, Bangladesh.Â  It "looks like it also walking/creeping with me in the beach and smiling too with me ğŸ˜Š"Â Photographer - Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , by my smartphone SamsungÂ A50. Duration of capture - Last year while I travelled there.Â Â If you are a nature lover and walk in the morning at sand beach or Sea shore, these flowers must attract you!,Â  and your mind obviously become cool and happy for a while!, It seems to be smiling with you from a sand beach, While you are walking in a sandy sea beech or sea shore specially in the morning â€“ Imagine, ~ â€œThe sounds of waves coming from horizon hitting at the sea shore or sand beach, makes our mindâ€™s with wonder and charm!â€ At the same time if you notice those flowers besides you!, which are smiling and creeping up with you! How do feel dear!? Express your opinion seeing my photosâ€¦â€¦!Â Â Anyway, Â Itâ€™s a so beautiful creeping plant (a kind of wild vine grows in the sandy and salty shore/beach) having with so attractive flowers! Have you ever heard about this flowers and do you know the flowers and creeping plants name? Pls.Â  let us know!Â What is the name of this plant and flower?:There is no appropriate Bengali name here in Bangladesh, but it looks like our very common â€œKolmiâ€ Flower (à¦•à¦²à¦®à¦¿ à¦«à§à¦²) so Its name in our country is Sagor Kolmi (à¦¸à¦¾à¦—à¦° à¦•à¦²à¦®à¦¿). In bengali language Â â€œSagorâ€ means â€œseaâ€, It generally live/grows in the sea shore or sea beach so, Its name is â€œSagor kolmiâ€ (à¦¸à¦¾à¦—à¦° à¦•à¦²à¦®à¦¿), It has other popular name, is Sagor lota (à¦¸à¦¾à¦—à¦° à¦²à¦¤à¦¾) in English it can be translated as â€œSea creepingâ€. Itâ€™s a creeping plants grows in the sea shore so its name also â€œSagor lota (à¦¸à¦¾à¦—à¦° à¦²à¦¤à¦¾)â€ The appearance of this leaf is the shape of the â€˜goat's foot hoofâ€™, so the other name of this creeping plant is â€œGoatkhur (à¦›à¦¾à¦—à¦² à¦–à§à¦°).In English language it is generally knowns asÂ  â€œBeach Morning Gloryâ€ or â€œCoastal morning gloryâ€, It is also known as â€œGoatâ€™s foot creeperâ€, Â â€œBay hopsâ€ etc..In Hindi (Indian) is called as â€œDo Patti Lataâ€What is the name of this flowers in your country dear???Â Letâ€™s know in briefÂ about this flower and the plant of â€œSagor Lotaâ€/ â€œSagor Kolmiâ€- or â€ Beach Morning GloryÂ Â Scientific name: â€˜Ipomoea pes-capraeâ€™Family: â€˜Convolvulaceaeâ€™Higher Classification: â€œFalse bindweedsâ€™Order: â€˜Solanalesâ€™Rank: â€œSpeciesâ€™You may see the below YouTube video (link provided) for more about this flower and creeping plant:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TbhumpLNICAÂ Taking photo of Sagor lataCaption: I am here capturing the photo of "Sagor Lata/Kolmi Lota" i.e. "Beach Morning Glory" in a morning last year with myÂ smartphone SamsungÂ A50, with a LG logo on the back cover, Photographer one of companion used my Smartphone "SamsungÂ J7pro" Photo captured from Inani Sea Beach, Cox's Bazar, Bangladesh.Â Â Â These plants can survive well in salty water and just on the pure sandy surfaces like sea shore, sand beach etc, this creeper has spread to many countries in the world by sea. As the seeds of this creeping plant are so tolerant of salt water and float in waterÂ Â  â€œSagarkalami/ Sagor lataâ€ or Beach Morning glory is one of the plants in which the ocean spread has occurred. It is generally seen at off the coast of the Atlantic, Pacific, Indian Ocean, New South Wales, Queensland Coast, Hawaii Island, Mexico, Africa, Florida. In Bangladesh we have long sea and sand beach, namely â€œCoxâ€™s Bazarâ€ , that is almost 120 km long, so Coxâ€™s Bazar sea beach is called as â€œWorldâ€™s largest sea beachâ€ So most of our coastal areas in Coxâ€™s bazar it easy can be found, Beside that Kuakata and St. Islands is can be seen easily.Â Â The leaves of these kind of creeping plant are bright green, its leaves look like (appearance) Goatâ€™s hoof. Its fruits and flowers are big and looks like a mike, Flowers bloom almost all the yearlong. Kalmi is very well known in Bengali language.Â Those flowers (Sagor lota) are very similar to the flowers, fruits and character of Kalmi. It is a thin herbaceous perennial herb. The width of the vine is 2 cm or less. Sequence 6.4 mm. The team is about 40 mm long. The fruit is brown in color and it contains four seeds. The seeds are black in color.Â Caption: A brunch of "Sagor Lata/Kolmi Lota" i.e. "Beach Morning Glory" ~ creeping plans are seen at the sand beach ofÂ Inani,Â Photographer - Local GuideÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , by my smartphone SamsungÂ A50. Duration of capture - Last year while I travelled there.Â Â Â The blue water and waves from the sea is now flowing freely on the shores of the sea. â€˜Sagar Lataâ€™ has lost its existence in the face of various man-made architectures, adversities and artificial installation in the shore are for tourism and other purposes. As the crowds in Cox's Bazar have decreased due to the corona virus, a fair of 'Sagar Lata' has started to be held on Cox's Bazar and other sea beaches in Bangladesh! Itâ€™s a very cool scene now! We should protect our earth, and these creeping plats too, for its normal breeding out!Â Our 'Slogan' always should be Â Â â€œSave the earth! And save our planet!â€Â You may be boring with long writing of me , so here I am ending up today!Â Have a great day my all loving LGs!ğŸŒ»ğŸŒ»Â Take care all my friends! Be safe, healthy and happy as well asÂ  smilingly always !Â ğŸ™ğŸ’œÂ MahbubWarm GreetingÂ ğŸŒ¹ from Chittagong city,Bangladesh.ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡©

	MD MAHBUB HYDER

title: Sharbats, Fresh fruits juices, and juicy fruits ~ I strongly recommend for Iftar (fast breaking) _ P
content:
Hi LGsğŸ‘‹Â Greetings for Holy Ramadan!ğŸ’šğŸ’›ğŸ§¡ğŸŒºğŸ‰Â You may know that one month Holy Ramadan is going on and most of the Muslim people are celebrating this holy Ramadan as a religious matter very sincerely and happily!Â Caption: Gifs of my some favorite drinks photos.Â  Â photos captured byÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ  by my smart phone Samsung A50Â Caption: One of my favorite juice ..Its a lemon juice with some sugar and put those in a glass of cold water ..some lemon slices floating onnthe top of glass, its a one of the best menuÂ on my Iftar table, photo captured byÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ  by my smart phone Samsung A50Â Caption: My favoriteÂ watermelonÂ fresh juice with some lemon slices on my Iftar table, photo captured byÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ  by my smart phone Samsung A50Â Caption: A simple IftarÂ recipe of me, Mango Juice, cornflakesÂ with milk, and salad ,Â photo captured byÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ  by my smartphoneÂ Samsung A50Â Caption: An Iftar foods items on my house diningÂ table , Lemon Juices, various fresh fruits slices, Bananas, "Chona" , "Peyaju", "Beguni" Chira with milk and coconut(Chira is made of rice), fruits custard, Cucumber slices..etc...,Â photo captured byÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ  by my smartphoneÂ Samsung A50Â What is Ramadan and fasting:Actually Ramadan is the very special month for Muslim, It continue one month and after completion of fasting, we celebrate, The â€œEid â€“Ul- Fitrâ€ or â€œEid festivalâ€, ~ the biggest festival for Muslim people! And this day is celebrated by almost whole world as a special national Holiday!Ramadan means not only just fasting (without having foods, drinks and sex) it is great month of "Peach". Moreover Ramadan month is a training periodÂ  for all Muslims 'for rectify ourselves!', it teaches us how to control ourselves as good man, how control our attitude, eating habits, behavior with other people, develop sacrifice mind, life styles and others human characters, develop prayers mind â€¦,,, in a word a Ramadan helps us to be a â€œreal pure manâ€! Muslims are trained by this holy months and continue their activities whole the yearlong as per training.Â Caption: Collage of some photos of fruits that generally I like eay at Iftar, Photographer @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ Anyway today my main intention to let you know what kind of foods I prefer at Iftar (fast breaking time). Fast breaking time is known by the Muslim in the world as â€œIFTARâ€, It is very hoy time and important time for all Muslim, This also a very good time for prayer and Allah (our creator) loves that time prayer too much (prayer just few minutes before Iftar)Caption: An Iftar foods items on my house diningÂ table , cold Lemon Juices, various fresh juicy fruits slices (Water lemon, papayas, pine apples, apples, local fruit "Bangi"..etc... ) beside those fruits custard and dates are also placed there..,Â photo captured byÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ  by my smartphoneÂ Samsung A50Â In our country we live in the tropical region, and maximum time in a year here is hot weather! And Ramadan is in this year at full summer period. We finish our last eating in the very early morning (about 04.00am) and we break our fasting about 06.20pm. As here we have to fast more than 14 hours, we become rehydrate and Â our body needs much water at ifter (fast breaking time), So I recommend for my Iftar liquid food much than other spicy and oily food! Actually Iftar is very special for all Muslim people, they always try to make delicious and some special foods at that time eat together with whole family, sometimes with neighbors, sometimes with friend and relatives and sometimes with office colleagues, Now a days Covid -19 pandemic situation is serious so we mostly take ifter with our family only. Although there are so many items have in the Iftar, but I strongly recommend you to all to eat some Sherbets, Fresh fruits juice (fruits make sliced and blended in the house), fresh cow milk, and other some healthy beverages. In here now Lemons, water melons, papayas, mangos and pineapples are available. These kinds of fruits juice can be the best drinks for Iftar. Â Besides that some Juicy fruits also will be the great foods for Â Iftar, Like Dates, bananas, pine apples, papayas, guavas, apples , Maltas, mangoes ets .. Now all the above mentioned fruits areÂ  available in our country.Â â€ƒCaption: Collage of some photos of drinks,Â  fruitsÂ  and other foods that generally I like to eatÂ at Iftar,Â  photosÂ are taken from my house diningÂ table, photographer:Â @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ Â Â In my house everyday I break my fasting (at Iftar) with "Dates" ( as it is our Sunnah, i.e. our prophet Hazrat Muhammad (SM) always beark fasting with dates, then i go (2nd choice) for Sharbat /special drinks (a very special Sherbat namely â€œRooh Afzaâ€. Rooh Afza is famous in Bangladesh, India and Pakistan. Now a days it also popular at some Arab countries. It is a healthy syrups that can make a healthy drinks too!Â Caption: 2 sizes of bottles of "Sherbat E Rooh Afza" can be found in the shops and markets!Â photo captured byÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ  by my smart phone Samsung A50Â Lets know in brief about "Sharbat- E - Rooh Afza"Â : It is one kind Herbal Syrups (beverage/drinks) Â made of some fruits, vegetables, roots and flowers. The producer of this syrup name is Hamdard (Waqf) Laboratories Company. It was first made in 1906 AD, in India. After 2nd world war it also establishedÂ  in Pakistan, and later 1971 after Liberation war It started factory in Bangladesh too.Â  It is red color syrup and generally need to mix with cold water. It is a very popular and tradition drinks for some countries even in Bangladesh, From generation to generation this syrup is used to make a delicious and healthy drinks. In my boyhood we heard its story from our parent that Roof Afza was very special syrup specially used in Iftar and Ramadan time too much for making a delicious cold drinksÂ Caption: I am pouringÂ  "Sharbat-Â E -Rooh Afza"Â into a glass of cold water with lemon slices by one of my hand and theotherr hand I usedÂ to capture this scene, by my smartphoneÂ Samsung A50, Here some fruits slice can beÂ seen too!Â Caption: My favorite and daily fixed items at Iftar ~ is "SharbatÂ E Rooh Afza" drinks with some lemon juice and slices in an IftarÂ table of my house, here other foodsÂ can beÂ seen, like curd (made of milk by fermenting), salad, "Jilapi" (a very popular sweet in our country evenÂ some other countries in Asia too)Â ;Â photo captured byÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ  by my smartphoneÂ Samsung A50Â Caption: Collage of some photos of drinks,Â  fruitsÂ  and other foods that generally I like eay at Iftar,Â  phptos are taken from my house dinning table, photographer:Â @MAHBUB_HYDERâ€ƒÂ Â Â â€ƒCaption: Collage of some photos of drinks,Â  fruitsÂ  and other foods that generally I like eay at Iftar,Â  phptos are taken from my house dinning table, photographer:Â @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ â€ƒCaption: Collage of some photos of drinks,Â  fruitsÂ  and other foods that generally I like eay at Iftar,Â  phptos are taken from my house dinning table, photographer:Â @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ How to make Sherbet e rooh Afza (Herbal Healthy drinks):Sharbat e Rooh Afza is very easy to make:Simple Sharbat can made one tablespoonÂ  syrup in a glass of cold or normal water and need Â some sugar (depends on people taste), generally one tablespoon sugar is enough to make it, Just sir with a spoon then you can have a delicious Sherbat, but you can mix some lemon juice for different taste and make it more healthy. You may put some ice bar to make it colder.Some people like Milky Sharbat -E-RoohÂ  Afza, You can also make it easily, just instead of water you may use one glass of cold milk and one table spoon of Rooh Afza syrup , one tablespoon sugar, then stir it nicely then if you like then put some ice bars and lemons for more tasty.Â Some people like â€œRoof Afzaâ€ syrup put in a cup or glass of ice-cream and put some nuts on it (almond, cashew nut, pesto nut Â too) for different flavor and taste.Pls go through the below link to see youtube video to know the benefit of Rooh Afza syrup:Â Â Benefit of drinking "Sharbat -E - Rooh Afza"Â Â Caption: An Iftar foods items on my house diningÂ table (on a different day) , Here can be seenÂ  Lemon Juices (in the white glasses), papaya juices (in the transparentÂ color glasses) various fresh fruits slices, "Halim (a spicy foods make of meats dal and many kinds of spices), "Chona" , "Peyaju", "Beguni" Chira with milk and coconut(Chira is made of rice), Payes ( a sweet food made of rice , milk and some different kindsÂ of nuts , Cucumber slices..etc...,Â photo captured byÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ  by my smartphoneÂ Samsung A50Â Ok. Again Let's come to the point.- Â I prefer always liquid food in Iftar, Along with Roof Afza Sharbat I also prefer fresh "juicy fruits juices" , mainly papaya, watermelon, pine apple , mangos, sometimes others depends on availabilityâ€¦Besides that I always eat bananas, apples, maltas,guavas and some other local fruits as per availability. I love eat curds, it is so healthy too. Although I want to avoid spicy and oiy food like Â â€œChona Â â€ , â€œBeguniâ€ , â€œPeyajuâ€ , â€œAlu chopâ€ but as a traditional food I have eat a little bit at times. At Iftar some sweet foods are also popular like â€œChiraâ€, Â â€œPayeshâ€, â€œ Curdâ€ ice cream. Sometimes we eat bread with beef or chicken curry too, Even sometimes we eat Â some rich food like Polao, Khichuri, Biryani etc at Iftarâ€¦Â Now your turn, Pls share your Iftar preferences here to let us know â€¦.Â Happy Ramadan Mubarak and advance Eid Mubarak to all ! It's Iftar Time for me now so need to be ended upÂ  go to my Iftar table at my sweet homeÂ ğŸ˜ Â !!Â Â Peace be upon you to all my beloved LGs!ğŸ™ğŸ•ŠÂ Have a great day!! ğŸŒ»ğŸŒ»ğŸ™Â Â MahbubWarm ğŸŒ¹ğŸŒ¹greetings from Chittagong city, Bangladesh. ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡©ğŸ’š

	MD MAHBUB HYDER

title: Little "Green Heaven" of mine -  part 1- Celebration of Earth day! Let's show our green places!
content:
Hi LGsÂ ğŸ˜How are you!GreetingsÂ ğŸ’ from Chittagong city, BangladeshÂ ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡©Happy Earth day!Â ğŸŒ²ğŸŒ³ğŸŒ¿Â Caption: Celebration of Earth DayÂ !Â ğŸŒ± Photo of Green leaves (Vegetables plant) at my house roof garden, by my Smartphone Samsung A50Â - PhotographerÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ Â Â Flowers of my garden - MahbubCaption: Closed up photo of pink colour flowersÂ  captured from my little heaven...Â  means from my roof top garden, by by Camera 'NIKON D3200' - PhotographerÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ Â Â Caption: Closed up photo of a flower (Local name here" Joba"l English name China rose)Â  captured from my little heaven...Â  means from my roof top garden, by my smartphone J7 Pro,Â  photographerÂ  @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ Â Caption: Earth Day celebration with green plantationÂ ğŸŒ± by me along with my ex. office colleagueÂ a few years ago, beside a paddy field trail road at KarnaphuliÂ upazilaÂ near the bay of BengalÂ  in Chittagong city, Bangladesh, ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡© Photo capturedÂ by my Smart phone Samsung J7 Pro, Help to captured it by my one companion!Â Caption: My little "Green heaven" - roof top garden with sitting place, captured by me yesterday with my smartphone Samsung A50, PhotographerÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ Â Â pudina plants ( leaves are used for edible mint)Caption: Closed up photo of Green leaves local name "Pudina leaves" ( a edible leave of mint that quite favourite in our country) captured from my little heaven...Â  means from my roof top garden, by Camera 'NIKON D3200' - PhotographerÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ Â Â My little green heaven/rooftop gardenCaption: My little "Green heaven" - roof top garden with sitting place, captured by me yesterday with my smartphone Samsung A50, PhotographerÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ Â Today I will show you a little Green Heaven at my Office and house roof top! If we are always keeping in mind and care for a beautiful clean and green earth! And we, everybody accordingly make our surrounding, clean and green!Â  You may have a little green heaven, at your house/ surroundings/ house roof/even at your office or working place! You may think how it possible?! Obviously you can make it!, we can make it!!Â ğŸ™‚ For the celebration of earth day, today I will show with my photography post how to make a green heaven!Â Last 2 year I could not celebrate Earth day along with my Office colleagues or friends for Covid 19 pandemic situation, But few years ago regularly before regularly I maintained/celebrated that day as physical and practical meet up! We selected a crowd place to do some voluntary jobs, like clean up/remove poly bags, polythene items, and plastic bottles, and some other wastages that harmed for environment, we do it as other people can learn/ become conscious about pollutions, bedside that after lunch break we went for plantations, We planted some fruits trees, some other trees that is used for making furniture!Green plantation by meCaption: Earth Day celebration with green plantation ğŸŒ±ğŸŒ±Â by me a few years ago, in chittagong city, BangladeshÂ Earth day celebration with a group in Chittagong cityCaption: Earth Day celebration with green plantation by me with a group a few years ago, in chittagong city, BangladeshÂ Earth day celebration with a group... clean the environment and  green plantationCaption: Earth Day celebration with green plantation by me with a group a few years ago, in chittagong city, Bangladesh... clean up and green plantationsÂ At a earth day programCaption: Earth Day celebration with green plantation ğŸŒ± by me with a group a few years ago, in chittagong city, BangladeshÂ Â Â Â But in this post my main intention is to show you guys how to keep your environment clean, tidy, well organized and greenâ€¦ means how can make your little word/surrounding Eco-Friendly and just like a green heaven!ğŸ˜Caption: A gif of some photos of my little grean garden with flowers at my house roof top, Photographer @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ â€ƒI have total 5 gardens, 3 are at my house roof , I have 3 roofs those all are planted with vegetables, fruits , and flowers,Â  gradually I will show you all my garden in Local stories. I have other 2 gardens. One is at my Office front balcony and other is my office roof.. I will let you know all gardens story with series .. 1,2,3,4,5â€¦ Pls keep touch with my next posts too! You may enjoy a lot! I will give you guarantee !!Â Today I will show you how can you keep your office or working place well organized , tidy and green! Your working place will become a small heaven for you too!! see my office photos ... it's not very difficult at all!, just need a special mind andÂ  part of time to take care and clean up even during your working period! If you are so busy at office work then make a time after office hours, I do it regularly ! so pls see my office environment!My Office name isÂ  M H InternationalÂ . Although i am proprietor of my company I do not hesitate to work for green environment along with my office staffs.Â My sitting place at officeCaption: My little green heaven - office desk,Â captured by me tonight with my smartphone Samsung A50 ; PhotographerÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ Â My private room/ conference roomCaption: My little green heaven - conference roomÂ office desk,Â captured by me tonight with my smartphone Samsung A50 ; PhotographerÂ @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ Â my office toiletCaption : My Office toilet, captured by me by smartphone Samsung A50Â My office kitchenCaption: My office kitchen.. captured by me by my smartphone Samsung A50Â My office interior - at a glanceCaption: My little Green heaven- Office interior- at a glanceÂ Â My office roof garden, a small green heavenCaption: My office roof garden- at a glabce- a small green heavenCaption: my office balcony with garden,Â  Captured by me bu my smartphone Samsung A50Â Â Caption: my office balcony with garden,Â  night view,Â  Captured by me bu my smartphone Samsung A50Â Caption: A view from my office desk of my office balcony with garden,Â  night view,Â  Captured by me by my smartphone Samsung A50Â How about your Little green heaven my friends!!?? Now your turns, Please Share your one in the comments........! Thank you!!!ğŸ˜ğŸ™Â MahbubLG from Chittagong city BangladeshğŸ‡§ğŸ‡©Â Â

title: So 'Adorable',..so 'eye catching',..so 'fresh and tasty...~ Photography of "Guavas" of my garden
content:
Caption: Flowers of guava that i captured from my house roof garden,Â Â photographer @MAHBUB_HYDER, Device : My smart phone - Samsung A50Â Caption: A plucked off guava in my hand that plucked off from Guava tree at my house roof garden,Â  photographer @MAHBUB_HYDER, Device : My smart phone - Samsung A50.Â Â Caption: A plucked off guava in my hand that plucked off from Guava tree at my house roof garden,Â  photographer @MAHBUB_HYDER, Device : My smart phone - Samsung A50.Â Â Hello my all beloved LGS! ğŸ’šğŸ™ğŸ¤Â How are doing my friends?!ğŸ¤©ğŸ™ğŸ¤Â Greetings ğŸŒ¹ğŸ‰Â  from Chittagong CityÂ  Â Bangladesh!ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡©Â  ğŸ’šğŸ§¡ğŸ’›ğŸ¤©Â Caption: A plucked off guava in my hand that plucked off from Guava tree at my house roof garden,Â  photographer @MAHBUB_HYDER, Device : My smart phone - Samsung A50.Â Â Â Â Caption: A gif of couples of my Captured some guavas photosâ€ƒNow a days in our country again "locked down" for the 2nd wave of Covid-19 pandemic situations! I feel so bored !, as I canâ€™t travel and lead my usual life, also I am a hobbyist photographer, traveler and tracker, so for me it more bored! Anyway to get-out from boring life I wanna show you some photography of Guavas that I planted at my house roof garden, I want to smile and make you some smile and chills by showing those photos. Pls. give your prompt reply and opinion about my post and photos!!!Caption: Cut pieces of Guavas collected from my house roof garden,Â  Captured by @MAHBUB_HYDER, By my smart phone- Samsung A50.Â Â Caption: Guavas are hanging out from my guava tree at my house roof garden,Â  photographer @MAHBUB_HYDERÂ , by Samsung A50Â Â Caption: Cut pieces and one full of Guavas collected from my house roof garden,Â  Captured by @MAHBUB_HYDER, By my smartphone- Samsung A50.Â Â Caption: A plucked off guava in my hand that plucked off from Guava tree at my house roof garden,Â  photographer @MAHBUB_HYDER, Device : My smart phone - Samsung A50.Â Â Caption: A plucked off guava in my hand that collected from my house roof garden,Â  photographer @MAHBUB_HYDER, Device : My smart phone - Samsung A50.Â Caption: A plucked off guava in my hand that plucked off from Guava tree at my house roof garden,Â  photographer @MAHBUB_HYDER, Device : My smart phone - Samsung A50.Â Â Â Caption: A plucked off guava in my hand that collected from my house roof garden,Â  photographer @MAHBUB_HYDER, Device : My smart phone - Samsung A50.Â Caption: A plucked off guava in my hand that plucked off from Guava tree at my house roof garden,Â  photographer @MAHBUB_HYDER, Device : My smart phone - Samsung A50.Â Â Today I would like to provide you a photography of Guavas and plants that I planted at my house roof garden in a big plastic drum (chemical drum that later used as my plantation), In the mean time I will remind you all that I have total 5 gardens that I take care regularly, Â In my house roof have 3 gardens one is medium size at my house 7th floor (flowers and decoration trees) , Â one is at 8th floor very big mainly I cultivate there vegetables and fruits, and roof top means at 9th floor I have a very beautiful roof garden with nice sitting facilities and flowers garden. In my some previous posts and comments I already posted and mentioned about my roof gardens. Later I will shoe you serially all my garden story in the Local stories section! Â Caption: Photo College of Guavas those collected from my house roof garden, Captured by me..Â Caption: A plucked off guava in my hand that collected from my house roof garden, in fron of sun! â˜€ï¸ photographer @MAHBUB_HYDER, Device : My smart phone - Samsung A50:Â Â As my photography on Guavas, So let us know something about this fruits!:Â â€œGuavaâ€ â€“ Itâ€™s a very common fruit in the tropical and subtropical regions. It mostly cultivate in India, Bangladesh, and other South East Asian countries, Mexico, Central America and some other countries. It can be found all the yearlong. But In Bangladesh It grows mostly in the summer and rainy season.Guavaâ€™s scientific name is â€˜Psidium guajavaâ€™, it has many local names in many regions. In Bangladesh it called Mostly â€œPeyaraâ€ some place it is called as â€œGoachiâ€. Mostly It looks Green color but after ripen it becomes light yellow- green. But Guava has different colors also, RadishÂ colored guavas as also available in Bangladesh! Red guava is also known as â€˜Red Appleâ€™. Guava plants are not so big, It can grows 2 meter to 10 meters long, but now a day small sized guava trees are available and it can easily grows in the roof garden even a jar or drum. I also planted it at my house roof gardenÂ in a drum.Â Â Caption: I planted a guava tree in a plastic drum at my House roof garden ğŸ˜photographer @MAHBUB_HYDER, Device : My smart phone - Samsung A50.Â Â Â Â Befit and nutrition of Guava:Guava is one the best healthy, enriched with full of nutritious what is worldwide trusted!It contains Vitamin A, Vitamin-c, Calcium, Sodium, Iron and many other minerals, Eating guava Â regularly helps you get more antioxidants that may help slow down the aging of your skin, It may boost up your immunity, help keep your heart good and healthy, control the blood sugar level. It may benefit at your digestive system. Guava are a weight loss friendly fruit too. Also there are so many benefits eating guavas regularly.Â Â AlthoughÂ it seems to be a Food article but I considered it mainly in photography to make you smile and pleasant!Â Â Â My Guava tree I planted almost two years ago in a drum at my House roof garden (at 8th floor). Now it fully grown up! Views of Guava plant, leaf , flowers and tender guavas, and ripen guavas are so enchanting and refreshing and eye catching. Sometimes I looks at my guava trees and feel so happy and pleasant in mindâ€¦. Â Caption: A guava is hanging on from my guava tree that I planted in a plastic drum at my House roof garden,Â photographer @MAHBUB_HYDER, Device : My smart phone - Samsung A50Â When I have much quantity of Guavas I offered some to my Neighbors to eat! content:
Hi LGS ğŸŒ¹Greetings from Chittagong city , Bangladesh ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡©â¤How are doing my loving friends?Â End of the the last month I had an opportunity to visit a beautiful resort at Gazipur, the resort name is Sarah Resort GazipurÂ Caption:Â  beautiful green paddy field with birds view ,Â  surroundings of the resort ğŸ˜€Â â€ƒcaption : inside views , childrens' park and villas views from the tower buildingÂ Â It is a heaven for nature lover â¤ any people. When i arrived there i was so pleased and surprised the natural views and their beautiful establishment of this resort. I arrived there with my wife @NILUFA73Â  who is a local guide too.. my wife also liked so much of thet resort! I recommend you too to visit that resort if you have any opportunity!Â Caption: views of surroundings from resort tower buildingÂ â€ƒCaption: views of surroundings from resort tower buildingÂ â€ƒCaption: views of surroundings from resort tower buildingÂ â€ƒCaption: views of surroundings from resort tower buildingÂ Caption: flower ? from their gardenÂ Caption: my wife watching and enjoying the flower's gardenÂ Caption: Natural beauty of resort surroundings , Captured by me from the tower buildingÂ Â Caption: a sunflower ? All the flowers gardens makes the resort natural beauty more attractive. You can make a sound breathing walking around the all Flowers ? garden ..Â They have a small canal cum lake made by them artificially inwhere yu can freely have a boat ride. This is other very attractive facility of this resort, you can anytime get ride a boat single or with your companion togetherâ¤Â Caption: A boat riding of a couple in te resortÂ Caption : boat riding view of myself , Captured by my wife with my smart phone Samsung A50 ?Â Besides that they have a very nice different flavour swimming ?â€â™€ï¸ pool that makes your trip so fresh and enjoyable , thay have floating bots made by air balloon and also the place decorated this so relaxing mood ? The access of the pool also free for all guestsÂ Caption: a beautiful floating object like a boat ? in the pool , my wife was on the boatÂ Caption : Pool view partial from Tower buildingÂ Caption : It's me in the pool on the floating boatÂ Â Caption: A selfie of myself alog with my wife ag the pool.Â They have also some very attractive restaurants inside the resort. you may enjoy your time there in anytime.Â Â On the way to or back from the resort you can Vowal forest areaÂ  if you from Dhaka city.
